page.title: 17Entertainment in Bingley
page.content: The old library building has been converted and now houses a dance club for ballet, tap dancing, dance exercises and aerobics, a pool room, an amusement arcade and a night club. The Arts Centre was opened in 974 and provides full theatre facilities with seating capacity for 373. The premises can be converted to a dance hall with bar and kitchen and are available for hire by the public. The Bingley Little Theatre presents a season of plays from June to October each year, while the Amateur Operatic Society gives regular performances of light opera to raise money for charity. The Young Idea is a recently formed group for young people, interested in taking part in musical activities.
